intro: Polygala neaei var. pearcei, commonly known as the pearce's milkwort, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually small and narrow, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
